Based on the user's preference cues, I would recommend "The Great Gatsby" (2013) from the list provided.

"The Great Gatsby" is a classic novel by F. Scott Fitzgerald. The story follows Jay Gatsby, a wealthy man who has won the heart of his former love, Daisy Buchanan. However, Gatsby's true identity remains a mystery, which makes him an enigmatic figure in American literature.

The movie adaptation of "The Great Gatsby" (2013) directed by Baz Luhrmann is widely regarded as one of the most iconic movies ever made. The movie features an ensemble cast including Leonardo DiCaprio, Michelle Yeoh, Jason Momoa, etc., and has won numerous awards including Academy Awards for Best Picture, Best Director, Best Adapted Screenplay, etc.

Having offended Poseidon, the God of the Sea, Odysseus is thwarted at every turn in his voyage, and even passes through the realm of the dead before reaching Ithaka, his kingdom.
